channel.title: PI Problems
channel.description: alright soo when i started coding i didnt go to a 317 i started off at a 718 awhile back. and i quit coding for a long ass time. im trying to start with a PI server. and the past couple of downloads i couldnt figure out how to switch ips.. i heard it was in the client.java but i could not find the ip on any 317 PI source i downloaded. where am i suppose to look to change the ip?

item.title: PI Problems
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xplode, post:10, topic:528251”][quote author=MrSnow1 link=topic=646999.msg4351136#msg4351136 date=1376664188]
CLIENT SIDE:

Open Client.java

search for server =

Change ip to 127.0.0.1 or 192.168.1.x w/e you want

other server wich does not has a client.java, therefor you need to open gui.java
[/quote]

Tried that i searched in the client.java for all ips the 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0, i did the server =, and just tried the 192.168. im not findin this crap anywhere haha[/quote]
What source/client did you download. Sometimes people that release them don’t actually change the IP. They also like to rename shit.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Problems

item.description:

[quote=“MrSnow1, post:9, topic:528251”]CLIENT SIDE:

Open Client.java

search for server =

Change ip to 127.0.0.1 or 192.168.1.x w/e you want

other server wich does not has a client.java, therefor you need to open gui.java[/quote]

Tried that i searched in the client.java for all ips the 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0, i did the server =, and just tried the 192.168. im not findin this crap anywhere haha

CLIENT SIDE:

Open Client.java

search for server =

Change ip to 127.0.0.1 or 192.168.1.x w/e you want

other server wich does not has a client.java, therefor you need to open gui.java

item.title: PI Problems
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

PI servers DO NOT require an IP server (source) sided. It is only client sided.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Problems
item.dc:creator: @i_call_dueces i call dueces
item.description:
@i_call_dueces wrote:

check ‘config.java’
config.java are for variables that dont change state (final), and can be called without creating an instance of the class it’s in (static)

its basically just a list of variables used through-out the server in different places, like a list of useful stuff. for convenience

Read full topic

Change the IP that your client connects to.
